results.title: At Henley
results.creator_credit: Seafield Head, Film Producers Guild and Verity Films
results.brief_description: The work of the Administrative Staff College at Henley where a method of managerial development is used to give further training to men and women in their late thirties and early forties. The work and final reports of some of the groups are shown.

results.title: At dawn: overcoming all fears
results.brief_description: Second in the nine-episode series “The History book”; an animated history of Western Civilization, this film examines Vasco da Gama’s voyages to Africa and India in 1497-99, his attempts to trade Portuguese goods for African and Indian goods, and the resultant violence by the Portuguese when the people in these countries refused to comply. Suitable for Lower Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: At 'Edge' with Judith Wright
results.creator_credit: Solrun Hoaas and Sync or Swim Documentaries
results.brief_description: A study of Judith Wright, her poetry and her links with the Australian landscape - in particular her relation to her property of “Edge” in Mangarlowe, N.S.W. Filmed at “Edge” in the Half-moon Wildlife District and featuring Roger Pulvers as the interviewer. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: Astronomy: an Open Learning unit
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open University
results.brief_description: This astronomy series features the southern skies particularly the work being done in Australia by scientists and astronomers who are trying to unravel the secrets of the universe. These programs are part of an Open Learning unit and can be viewed in conjunction with the series entitled “Universe: the infinite frontier.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open University

results.title: Astronauts and jellybeans
results.creator_credit: Dan Bessie, Severo Perez and Learning Garden
results.brief_description: Animation and live action are used to outline the development of the spoken and written language, beginning with the earliest diagrammatic and pictorial forms of communication. Notes the importance of the written word, the use of the dictionary, and the sound of words.

results.title: Astonish me: Graeme Murphy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Creative Spirits Series”.
An examination of Australia’s leading choreographer and founder of the internationally acclaimed Sydney Dance Company. In exploring the background to his creativity, Graeme returns to Mathinna, Tasmania for the first time in thirty years. There he talks about his childhood adventures, his inspiration for dance and his early days at the Australian Ballet.

results.title: Asteroids, comets and meteorites
results.creator_credit: Herbert Schick and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: This film opens with pictures of man-made satellites and proceeds to show the characteristics of the minor members of the solar system - asteroids, comets and meteorites. Animated diagrams show the ways meteorites, comets and asteroids move in the system. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Asterix and Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Pino Van Lamsweerde, Yannik Piel, Dargaud Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Thanks to the magic potion made by a Druid, Asterix the tiny Gaul has mighty powers. With his pal Obelix they make life miserable for the Roman soldiers unlucky enough to live near their village. This adventure finds our heroes in Egypt. The Egyptians are famous for their pyramids, but this doesn’t impress the Romans when every other building in Egypt is in danger of falling down. So when Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt, has a blazing row with Julius Caesar, the Roman Emperor, it’s the start of an amazingly funny adventure for Asterix. His task is to build a palace fit for a queen in only a few weeks and win Cleopatra’s bet! Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: Astacus (the crayfish)
results.brief_description: The crayfish is examined as an example of an animal having an external skeleton; the function and structure of each individual part of the skeleton is studied. Detailed consideration is given to the male and female reproductive organs, the arterial system, the nervous system, and the process of feeding and digestion.
